content.subtitle: July is going out faster than a Chinese missile across the Nevada desert sky.

virtuals.subtitle: July is going out faster than a Chinese missile across the Nevada desert sky.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
August is a big birthday month in my household. My daughter Rory and I are one day apart â€” me on the 21st and her on the 22nd, so weâ€™re having the annual RoJo birthday bash here in a few weeks, which Iâ€™m pretty excited about. Even though sheâ€™s totally hijacked my birthday â€” all the gifts are hers and my birthday is now full of pink balloons, princesses, etc. (Iâ€™m not bitter or anything â€” just saying)â€¦

That said, I hope this letter finds you in a cool place.

content.subtitle: Our â€˜hang-upsâ€™ are actually brilliant (although misunderstood) solutions to a high-stress, low-mood, unsettled state of mind.

virtuals.snippet: Our â€˜hang-upsâ€™ are actually brilliant (although misunderstood) solutions to a high-stress, low-mood, unsettled state of mind.
virtuals.subtitle: Our â€˜hang-upsâ€™ are actually brilliant (although misunderstood) solutions to a high-stress, low-mood, unsettled state of mind.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
This goes for most every kind of so-called â€˜issueâ€™ I can think of â€” drugs, alcohol, violence, sex, spending, eating disorders, Pokemon Go, etc.

Unlike a lot of the experts, I donâ€™t believe these â€˜hangupsâ€™ to be the â€˜diseaseâ€™ part of the equation. I see dis-ease as something that comes from our thinking in the moment. The remedy is the thing we reach for (above) to cancel out that feeling of dis-ease which stems from our thoughts in the moment.

content.subtitle: In our culture, personality is king. From headlines to covers of magazines while weâ€™re in line at the grocery store to advertisements andâ€¦

virtuals.snippet: In our culture, personality is king. From headlines to covers of magazines while weâ€™re in line at the grocery store to advertisements andâ€¦
virtuals.subtitle: In our culture, personality is king. From headlines to covers of magazines while weâ€™re in line at the grocery store to advertisements andâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
social media â€” the strong/powerful personality/personal brand seems to be the brass ring of success.

Even in school, there are personalities we look up to, those we look down on, and those we see when we look in the mirror (which shift, moment to moment).

However, we reach a point where we see that personality is extremely limited and frail. Itâ€™s easily wounded and constantly â€˜dissedâ€™ as it strives to gain approval from others/ourselves.

virtuals.subtitle: Off the Cuff Episode 5
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Confidence... Itâ€™s a huge deal. It seems to come natural for some of us (yes, â€˜thoseâ€™ people). As for others, we couldnâ€™t find confidence if it jumped up and bit us in theâ€¦ nose.

It can seem like a constant struggle. So how do we cope? Do we have to develop some kind of huge Anthony Robbins-esque personality? Do we have to get really good at confrontation and the â€˜art of influencing peopleâ€™?

I think thatâ€™s all bullsh*t.

c84c97795875.title: Being okay with not being okay

content.subtitle: If you closely examine â€˜stressful situations,â€™ youâ€™ll likely realize somethingâ€¦

virtuals.snippet: If you closely examine â€˜stressful situations,â€™ youâ€™ll likely realize somethingâ€¦
virtuals.subtitle: If you closely examine â€˜stressful situations,â€™ youâ€™ll likely realize somethingâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
â€¦

The thing thatâ€™s most stressful isnâ€™t necessarily the situation itself. Itâ€™s the self-talk that goes on about the situation that causes the anxiety. The problem is that certain part of our psyche thatâ€™s not okay with the fact that weâ€™re not okay.

This adds more and more pressure. Layers and layers of stressful thought get buried on top of the experience, making it damn near unbearable.

But check this outâ€¦

Being okay with feeling uncomfortable makes youâ€¦ (strangely) comfortable.

content.subtitle: When you get a cut or a bruise, your body goes to work in all sorts of mysterious ways to heal itself â€” all without you even knowing aboutâ€¦

virtuals.snippet: When you get a cut or a bruise, your body goes to work in all sorts of mysterious ways to heal itself â€” all without you even knowing aboutâ€¦
virtuals.subtitle: When you get a cut or a bruise, your body goes to work in all sorts of mysterious ways to heal itself â€” all without you even knowing aboutâ€¦
virtuals.emailSnippet:
it. You donâ€™t have to consciously work to create new skin cells, attack the virus, or bring down the swelling. Your job is to stay out of your systemâ€™s way and not cause it any more undue stress so it can do its thang. Chicken wang (sorry, I couldnâ€™t resist)â€¦

If you take a pair of pliers in your right hand and squeeze your left index finger with them (because, why not?) you will experience pain. Slight at first and ever-increasing the more damage you inflict on your digit.

content.subtitle: All events are neutral. The worst thing that could happen is a neutral event.

virtuals.snippet: All events are neutral. The worst thing that could happen is a neutral event.
virtuals.subtitle: All events are neutral. The worst thing that could happen is a neutral event.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Until we come along and assign a story to it. We assign it with different degrees of good or bad.

Letâ€™s say something happens and we assign a bad story to it. Really bad. This thought creates a negative experience out of it. We get emotional. We may burst into tears, slam our fist through a wall, or even worse.

And then, what do we do? We cut the experience off at the knees by suppressing or rationalizing it.

paragraphs.name: fdb2
paragraphs.text: All events are neutral. The worst thing that could happen is a neutral event.

5b5965827e32.title: You canâ€™t think your way to a quiet mind

content.subtitle: Answers, solutions, insights, and creative solutions emerge from a quiet mind.

virtuals.snippet: Answers, solutions, insights, and creative solutions emerge from a quiet mind.
virtuals.subtitle: Answers, solutions, insights, and creative solutions emerge from a quiet mind.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
When our heads are full of rabid monkey thoughts, itâ€™s hard to see the forest for the trees.

But hereâ€™s the thingâ€¦ When we try to quiet the mind â€” when we use thought to quiet thought â€” itâ€™s like fighting fire with fire. All we do is add more thinking to our thinking.

We get into a quiet, creative, potentialized mind by turning our attention from our thoughts to the physical and psychological beingness of the present moment.

paragraphs.text: You canâ€™t think your way to a quiet mind
